Content: I watched Adolescence. As a Social Worker, Psychologist & Psychotherapist of 40 years, I watch such programmes with a critical eye and generally such programmes disappoint as the writers have been lazy in their understanding of psychological issues and police procedures.  This programme's writer had done their homework except for a small error in that an AA, whoever they are, cannot sit in on Solicitor's sessions with their clients, not since the Fred West case as an AA can now be called to give evidence so what is said to the Solicitor in the presence of an AA is no longer confidential.  Also while the psychologist was played well (I am also an expert witness and train therapists, etc) therapists and psychologists are generally trained not to ask questions using the word 'Why' ! Your psychologist used this far too much instead of how, what, etc questions.  'Why' is a blocking question, so would not easily elicit an answer.  Good interviewers on TV rarely use this word.  Unfortunately, the otherwise very good writer had missed these points.  But the programme otherwise did address an important issue that is going under the radar for adults i.e. the problems of cyberbullying amongst young people that are not seen by schools or the parents and other adults around the children and can cause considerable mental health issues among school children.
Title: I watched Adolescence

Title: Worst customer service ever

Content: As soon as there is a problem, you can count on having the worse conversations with Netflix.I recently changed residence from Austria to the Philippines. I cancelled my account in january so i would not be charged for february.I got charged for february and march.After talking to support I was told i was eligible for a refund only for february as the system said i was streaming on march.Dont' have to tell you that that is not possible because a) the profile that was streaming was my mothers, and she is not in a mental state to operate an app and even less to go to my account and activate it with my credentials.dI requested the IP from the device and was told they dont have that information (btw, Netflix has that information - im getting emails everytime when i login to a new device and it includes my IP)I was told that technicians will have a look at it.2 Days ago, i got another charged for a membership from Netflix saying "welcome back". I got in touch with support and they refunded my the amount and said i will receive both refunds (me assuming the other one is for march). I received 1 refund, so i got in touch where the other one was and they played dumb and told me the same thing and that there area no technicians to reach out to me.I also requested the chat history 3 times (everytime i got in touch) and was told that it will be sent via email when i request it after the chat, i never saw that option and i never received a chat history via email.Taking legal steps over 13.99 euro is usually not my thing but a the grade of  incompentence that netflix confronts users with is beyond.When I asked about the email for legal issues as i wanted to bring this to the consumer proctection in EU, i was told that there is no such email but "i can help with a number) - guess what.. the number is from support, the same team the guy i was talking to was in and he confirmed that. When asked about the difference I (!!!) got annoyed answers. I'm a Neflix costumer for at least 7 years and never had issues. but it seems once you are there, you wont care about 7 careless years, its just the very high grade of incompetence that is the problem.
Title: Worse Costumer Service Ever

Content: ‘With Love Meganut’ has pushed me over the realms of sanity; that and an increase to a monthly £12.99 subscription has pushed my finger onto the cancel membership button.  Do I wish to provide Netflix with the funds to produce Meeeeeeagain doing basic kitchen porter ‘prep work’, dripping in beige, whilst flapping her gums with special needs gibberish – NO.  How many three- and five-year-old children would eat a sack of fruit plopped onto a plate for breakfast – NONE; not even if you put it in a MaccyD box with toy.How many children under five would pick off flower flakes in repulsion that they are bugs and refuse to eat the rest, convinced there is a nest at the bottom of the pile - ALL.  How many children under ten would manage half a gobful of banana to then finish it in the car, leaving nice mashed white fibre everywhere - MOST.  Would a middle-aged monkey give more entertainment using sign-language to read a pop-up book on drain cleaning – YES.Should the cameraman have applied Megafairyflakes with a straight jacket when she announced that her family surname was Sussex - ABSOLUTELY.  Would the middle-aged monkey get commissioned to use sign language to read a pop-up book of the history of royal descendants and their surnames - YES.  Should the county of Sussex be paid compensation for being labelled the namesake of a mentally deficient security risk - YES.What the actual has happened to Netflix associating themselves and our subscription money with this bunkum when there is ‘Somebody Feed Phil’ for instance; fantastic camerawork and it’s actually really interesting, funny and needs an 8th series.  Instead, we’ve been given the clear demise of Megundone in a diary format from Megxit to Megdillusional wherein she’d screw up an advert for Megnum; her version of face planting into a Magnum bar in an effort to blend in with inmates of whatever institution that she belongs.
Title: ‘With Love Meganut’ ...seriously?

Content: I love, love, love Meghan's new show. I watched the first episode last night and was left with a relaxed and beautiful feeling. She demonstrated some fantastic, lovely ideas. I also thought it so cool that she didn't look directly into the camera to "give lessons". Instead, it was like we were right there with her, enjoying the beautiful surroundings.
Title: I love, love, love, Meghan's new show

Content: With Love, Meghan (Series) On a positive, each of Meghan’s eight shows are presented beautifully; however, unlike Martha Stewart and Nigella she does not interact with the audience whatsoever.  Her ‘ideas’ are unoriginal. Like almost everything else presented, (rainbow fruit platter) all are non-bespoke nor unique/creative. It is disappointing that Meghan needs her Celebrity ‘friends’ and Chefs to prop her up. Without them the show is flat.  Where, in the Series, are the ‘regular’ Mums who don’t have high profiles?  Meghan is filming in a borrowed house whilst portraying a ‘perceived’ perfect life, which is non-relatable and unauthentic. Too, she abandoned royal life yet stated to her friend that her Sussex surname is ‘so meaningful’ (and no doubt her Duchess Title as well). One cannot have it both ways.  Where is her integrity?I read that Netflix paid Meghan $100M. 😳.  Why?
Title: With Love, Meghan

Content: Netflix apparently doesn't give a damn about customer service. No matter what time/how many times I called, the message said "we are receiving higher than call volume" and calls are hung up.  Finally on a Sunday evening, I got hold of someone. I ask the guy a simple Q to tell me what the email address is for customer service. All my emails, replying to the ones they sent from (no, it's not a no reply one either) bounced back!!  The guy says he'll send me an email with the info and when I got it, I l click on it and all I see is the stupid physical address in CA!! What the hell?  They want me to write a letter and mail it snail mail now?!!  The guy wouldn't even answer why he can't give me an email address!! Then he says he'll find a supervisor for me.  Shockingly after 25 mins of waiting, the supervisor came online (a lady) but she couldn't hear me she says!! I kept talking and begging her not to hang up bcoz I could hear her and sure enough, she disconnected the call. IS THIS A GAME THEY PLAY ON PAYING CUSTOMERS?!!  I am pissed off with them and their pathetic service after having been a long time subscriber.  I am going to nix netflix.

Content: On February 21, I attempted to watch Netflix but could not access my subscription until I agreed to a price increase effective March 17. I called 1-844-542-4813 to express my frustration, feeling like I was being held hostage by their shoddy business practices regarding price increases. I should be able to access my paid subscription until I decide if I agree to the price increase. The representative instructed me to accept the price increase on screen if I wanted to watch Netflix tonight and call back to cancel before March 17. This is an unacceptable and deceitful business practice by Netflix and a complete waste of my time. When I escalated my concerns to a supervisor, he said he couldn’t assist me either. He advised me to call back another time because no one else with any authority could help me. When I asked for his name, employee number, or reference number for my complaint, he told me his name was “John” and could not provide any further information to track my complaint. To add to the awful customer service experience, the representative and supervisor constantly cut me off in the conversations. NETFLIX, please listen to the recording at 8:20 PM to see how your condescending customer service representative treats your customers. Good riddance Netflix.

Content: Used to be the de facto for shows and movies and I have been a customer for many years.My partner and I stay sometimes in different cities (in Germany) for a few days, due to work and we are sharing ONE Netflix membership. With the recent changes in the terms and the price increase, we could not share the same membership anymore (I know there is an option when you are traveling, etc. but looked like too much hassle...).Most likely by a... "convenient" mistake, the same time my partner downgraded her membership, I was charged a monthly subscription for a Netflix membership and for a Netflix account I do not have. Strangely enough, the amount was directly deducted from my checking account.Of course, I contacted my bank and disputed the charge, and at the same time I tried to contact Netflix to make sure this doesn't happen again.Of course, mistakes happen, and my review is not strictly related to this unauthorized charge, but to the fact that when I called customer support (Netflix Germany), they refused to help me because they only provide support in the German language!Really ???I might live in Germany, but that doesn't mean that I speak German. I speak though the INTERNATIONAL language of English!A company, and in this case an American company, which operates internationally should at least be able to provide support in the English language besides the local language of the country it operates in.Any company which does not provide their services in the INTERNATIONAL language of English and as such discriminates and disrespects the foreigners living in that country is not worth my business!Eventually, I was able to chat with someone in English and after 45 minutes of messaging back and forth and trying to explain what the issue is, I was informed that they will look into this...That was the end of Season 1...My lawyers will take care of Season 2 if I have to deal  with this again...

So the only option was to close the account and cancel the payments, which I done and they said they would refund me the £17.99 payment that had gone through that day, hang on! I only pay £4.99, upon checking my credit card my subscription had gone up from £4.99 to £17.99 something I didn’t agree to and it all happened on the day my email account had been changed, slightly suspect, but Netflix couldn’t explain why and basically was trying to put the blame on me saying I had done it when I hadn’t.  I’m sorry Netflix but there is something odd going on here and you couldn’t explain it so I have just cancelled, I await the refund and hope no more transactions go through, security on the account doesn’t seem that safe to me.

Content: I am deeply disappointed and frustrated with Netflix’s lack of security and transparency. My account email ID was changed without my consent, which raises serious concerns about how secure Netflix really is.Normally, Netflix requires an OTP to log in from a new device, so how could someone bypass this and change my login email ID? When I contacted customer support, they could not even tell me the email ID to which my account had been changed. Although they helped me recover my account through an alternate email, the whole experience was stressful and left me feeling completely insecure about the safety of my data.To make matters worse, when I asked how this breach could have occurred, the customer support representative ignored my question and disconnected the chat. Such unprofessional behavior is unacceptable, especially when dealing with a security issue.I no longer trust Netflix with my personal information and have requested that they delete all my data from their system. A platform with such weak security measures and unhelpful customer service is not worth the risk.I would strongly advise others to think twice before trusting Netflix with their personal information.
Title: Extremely Insecure Platform – Account Compromised Without Authorization

Content: Netflix’s recent household restrictions are a blatant and insulting money grab that only highlights how far the streaming giant has fallen from its once-dominant position. By implementing rigid policies that block sharing accounts across households, Netflix has alienated loyal customers who have long relied on their service to connect with family and friends. The move reeks of corporate greed, with no meaningful justification beyond boosting profits at the expense of customer goodwill.What makes this change even more egregious is the lack of any notable improvement in the platform’s content quality. If Netflix were using this policy shift to fund groundbreaking original programming or significantly enhance its user experience, there might be some small shred of justification. Instead, the platform continues to churn out uninspired, forgettable series and movies that don’t come close to justifying its inflated subscription prices.Netflix seems oblivious to the fact that the streaming market is more competitive than ever. Services like Hulu, HBO Max, and Disney+ are offering superior content and features without resorting to such desperate tactics. By penalizing users for account sharing—a practice they once encouraged—Netflix risks driving subscribers to its competitors, who appear far more in tune with customer expectations.The attempt to squeeze every last penny from subscribers while delivering the same underwhelming library shows how disconnected Netflix has become from the people who built its success. It’s a short-sighted decision that damages trust, alienates customers, and reveals a company more focused on quarterly profits than long-term value.For a company that built its reputation on innovation and customer-centric policies, this is nothing short of a betrayal. Netflix may soon learn the hard way that punishing its customers is no way to maintain market dominance.

Content: I’ve been a loyal subscriber to Netflix was more than 15 years.  What I’ve witnessed recently is Netflix’s policy of gouging the consumer more and more.  First they added the policy of people not being able to share your account. And this is with everyone in your household!  So, if I’m traveling for work, which I frequently do, my son can’t watch Netflix at home.  In addition, they added the “ad version” where they show adds during the movies you’re watching.  They’re making millions of dollars off of these ads, but they’re still charging us to watch movies.There used to be 1 or 2 adds during the entire movie.  Now the ads are every 5 min or so.  Besides that, Neftilx’s stock is at all time highs.  Their profits are through the roof, but this still isn’t enough for their greed.My feeling is, it’s time to organize a worldwide boycott of Netflix. Maybe that would bring that back into a more balanced and fair market view.
Title: Netflix - Greedy corporate that keeps gouging consumers

Content: The best feature about Netflix is that I can cancel my membership at any time. I find that after about 1-2 months, if I watch a series or film 3-4 times a week I will run out of good quality or interesting or well-made things to watch. These are areas they need to improve on: pay real documentary makers or BBC or National Geographic to make your nature documentaries or any of them because they are so amateurish it makes for difficult watching; Chef Amaury's School of Chocolate was hugely disappointing as I was super excited to see him in action, learn more about chocolate and about him but no sadly it was a 'reality TV' disaster set in a kitchen. Really poorly made with only flashes of Chef Amaury working. I will go back to watching him on YouTube now. You have had a few hits with Bridgerton and other shows and films that are produced elsewhere but that you part fund or sponsor and they are definitely better but quality-wise you have a way to go. The best content however is good films/series bought in. As long as you have the easy cancellation feature I will return every now and then and catch up on those.
Title: Good with easy cancellation feature

When I said it’s been happening for months now, the guide asked if I’ve been travelling after I already explained I hadn’t. I gave up. Content: It is bad enough that Netflix requires a subscription to see an NFL game, but at least when Prime does it, subscribers can ACTUALLY SEE THE GAME. Worse, when you contact Netflix, they don't offer a refund, just a lame apology about "incompatibility" that they created.  I fully expect that soon I will be told that I need a new TV to view anything on Netflix.Who would be satisfied watching a game on a tiny cell phone display or crowding the family around a PC instead of your monster TV?  That's what I got for my subscription!  Time to review the value of that expense.

Content: Great shows, but their customer service has only gotten worse.  Like many companies, they have clearly offshored their customer service, so Netflix customers are now left having to speak to robotic reps from half-way across the globe, and who have zero problem-solving skills.  They are simply hen-pecking..reading from manuals...'escalating' the issue to someone else, etc..  Every issue takes ten times as long, now, to resolve.  So irritating...  Today, I actually had a rep ask me to 'take a video' of the problem on my Netflix screen, and to then email the video to her.  She said 'let me know once you've emailed the video to me' (while she apparently planned to wait, and continue to sit with me on the call...).  But as I said to her 'how can I take a video (with my phone) if I'm currently ON the phone with you?  (Most or all mobile phones do NOT have the capability to TAKE a video WHILE you are also in the middle of a call, with that same phone.)  Argh!!Meanwhile, Netflix leadership rake in ever higher salaries, paying their C.S. reps squat, and their customers having to suffer as well, in the process.

Content: I really love Netflix.  Netflix offers an unparalleled viewing experience that makes it a joy for entertainment lovers. The platform is rich with diverse content, from gripping series to blockbuster movies, catering to a wide array of tastes and preferences. One of the most delightful aspects of Netflix is its regularly updated library. New movies and shows are consistently added, ensuring there’s always something fresh to watch.  The app’s notification system is particularly helpful, keeping you informed about new releases and recommendations tailored to your viewing habits. This personalized touch enhances the user experience, making it easy to stay up-to-date with the latest additions.  The streaming quality is exceptional, with sharp visuals and smooth playback that elevate your viewing experience. Coupled with its competitive pricing, Netflix offers excellent value for money, making premium entertainment accessible to all.  Overall, Netflix combines variety, convenience, and quality in a way that few streaming services can match, making it a favourite for viewers worldwide.
Title: I really love Netflix

Content: I have been a long-time Netflix user and generally enjoy their original content and wide selection of shows. HOwever the experience of trying to watch live-streamed events has been frustrating. During the Tyson-Jake fight, the stream kept buffering and even droped multiple time despite being directly connect to a high-speed internet line. I've never had this issue with Disney and Amazon so it's clearly a Netflix-specific problem. For regular shows the buffering isn't as frequent, but for live events, Netflix clearly isn't ready to complete. Again, it's great platform for series but until they fix their streaming issues I can't fully recommend them for live events.   Edit 1: still has one of the best catalogs out there! Can't wait to see "Do't die" in January :) Edit 2: loved Squid Game season 2! Definitely makes me want to keep my subscription

(Blue eye samurai,  Love death + robots,  Cyberpunk, Squid game, Sweet home, Vikings Valhalla, Norsemen, The last kingdom, ragnarok, Peaky Blinders, Kingdom, etc) As far as other shows, when they are preachy and contain to many "woke" messages they lose a lot of the wow factor. Content: I have no choice but to cancel Netflix as it shuts down/freezes my Brand new 2024 TV when certain adverts come on during a Netflix program or film. I have contacted Netflix a couple of times about this and they blame my TV and my broadband company, this simply isn't the case as they both work perfectly, there's only ever an issue during adverts on Netflix...! I feel £5 a month is a reasonable price for Netflix, I wouldn't want to pay more than that due to the fact there is very few things worth watching on there, 85% of Netflix is absolute rubbish. However, I will have to cancel due to the problem with the adverts shutting everything down. If anyone can explain why the problem occurs and how to fix it then I may consider keeping it but that would take somebody from Netflix to be honest and own the fact that it's something wrong Netflix's end.

Content: I’ve been a Netflix member for many years but hardly used it until recently. Now that I’m using it daily, I’m extremely disappointed with the options available. The content seems overwhelmingly negative, with poorly curated movies and a lack of quality educational material or engaging documentaries.The selections for my country are simply ridiculous. For example, there’s a dedicated Filipino section. While I understand the large Filipino community here in the Middle East, the platform should cater to a wider variety of tastes. Why not have balanced sections for different regions, like Africa, Germany, or other diverse cultures, instead of focusing heavily on just a few?The recent content updates for September, October, and November have been especially bad. In my opinion, Netflix is no longer worth the subscription, and I plan to cancel my membership.

Content: Email to Netflix CEO.  No response.  I am writing to express my extreme disappointment with the customer service I received following the Tyson fight.After experiencing significant issues during the event, I contacted your support team the following day. After a 10-minute wait, the representative was unable to provide satisfactory answers to my questions. When I requested to be transferred to a supervisor, the representative abruptly hung up on me.I sought assistance through your chat support this morning, and I was told that the issues were caused by a server overload. The rep stated that the overloaded server was not a human issue so nothing we can do.  My question is.... which human did not get enough servers? Rajshree the supervisor that I was on chat with said I was lying about being hung up on and that I could not watch the fight.  Rajshree said they are the last point for customer service and no one to be transferred to.  While I understand that technical difficulties can occur, it is unacceptable to dismiss customer concerns and accuse them of dishonesty.I have been a loyal Netflix customer for many years and have never encountered such poor service. It is disheartening to be treated with such disrespect, especially when your company is experiencing record profits. I urge you to take immediate action to address these issues and improve your customer support.
Title: Profit over people

Content: Pessimo. Evento del decennio Tyson contro Paul Jake, si sapeva da un anno che avrebbe fatto più di 100 milioni di telespettatori in diretta, eppure tutto bloccato dall'inizio alla fine con una connessione da 100 MegaByte/sec. Toccato aspettare 20 minuti, ma chiaramente svegliarsi alle 4 di notte per la diretta e trovarsi questo ben servito é indice che questa azienda sta precipitando. Certo, c'era tanta gente in streaming per un incontro di pugilato, ma ci sono eventi mondiali di calcio e altri sport che fanno numeri simili o superiori e non ho mai avuto questi problemi, o almeno non un blocco totale fino alla fine della diretta.Very bad. Event of the decade Tyson vs Paul Jake, it was known for a year that it would have more than 100 million viewers live, yet everything was blocked from start to finish with a 100 MegaByte/sec connection. Had to wait 20 minutes, but clearly waking up at 4 in the morning for the live broadcast and finding this well served is an indication that this company is going downhill. Sure, there were a lot of people streaming for a boxing match, but there are world football events and other sports that have similar or higher numbers and I've never had these problems, or at least not a total block until the end of the live broadcast

Content: Two weeks ago, my account started having a strange issue: all the movies went dark. I could hear audio, see the trailers, and even watch the first few minutes of a show, but then everything would just go dark. It took me hours to reach customer support, and when I finally did, they told me that I should update my browsers, restart my computer, and update my iOs. I told them that the problem must be elsewhere because I could still see the trailers and parts of the movies. But the guy told that he has solved my problem and just ended the conversation. I contacted them again. And again - I explained my problem and told them that I had updated everything (which I did) and that it didn't help. Then the guy told me that Netflix did it to my account because I am traveling in France now. I was shocked - no notification, no message, nothing. They waited several days for me to try to reach them, then made me update all my browsers (because none of them worked with Netflix), my iOs, etc. And then their solution is - I should create a new account in France. What??? Really? Why should I? And then again create a new account when I get back home? I was pissed, of course. So he promised to speak to his manager, asked me to wait, and disappeared. Then I contacted them again. And guess what? Yes, the guy told me to update my browsers again because it's a computer problem. I told him about what the previous consultant told me. But this guy said it's not true, the problem is with my computer, I should contact Apple (!!!) and he ended the conversation. And then he sent me a memo on how to restart my computer and how to update my browsers!!! When I reached out once more, they reverted to saying it was due to my location in France. And as I was typing my response, the chat ended. This help desk experience couldn’t have been more frustrating. Their customer support is seriously lacking. And I can use my Netflix as a radio.
Title: Decided to travel? No movies for you

Content: As a long-term subscriber, I expected Netflix to maintain transparent and user-friendly practices for account and billing management. Unfortunately, recent experiences have proven otherwise, especially regarding changes to the billing cycle and the lack of clear guidance.Firstly, Netflix fails to clearly communicate the effects that changes to your account can have on the billing cycle. Adjustments to plans or billing settings seem straightforward but can lead to unexpected surprises with billing dates and charges. There’s no advance warning about how seemingly minor adjustments might impact your billing schedule, which is a basic aspect of customer transparency.Moreover, Netflix's inflexibility around billing dates is deeply inconvenient. Once an adjustment has been made, you’re effectively stuck with the new billing date—even if it doesn’t suit your schedule. A simple request to revert to the original date or select a preferred billing cycle cannot be accommodated, as Netflix lacks any option to adjust billing cycles once they’re set.The only workaround is to cancel your subscription entirely and rejoin on a date that aligns with your preferred billing schedule. This, however, is a frustrating solution with a major downside: you lose your profile’s watch history, preferences, and recommendations. For those who’ve built up years of personalised content, this is an enormous drawback that Netflix doesn’t adequately address. It’s a surprising oversight for a company that prides itself on understanding user data.Overall, Netflix could improve in both clarity and flexibility. The lack of clear communication and billing flexibility is disappointing
Title: As a long-term subscriber

Content: I have used Netflix for many years. While on vacation I wanted to burn off a few calories using an elliptical Stair-master. To keep my mind off the exercise I clicked on my Netflix app on my phone and used earbuds. However, I could not sign in, I kept getting a message to try again later? Another time I got a message stating my password was wrong. I had watched a series on Netflix the night before using the same ID and password that worked fine on the TV in the hotel. After changing my password three times and still I could not sign in on my phone. I got the usual message to click on multiple links stating different possible solutions none of which fit my problem. Then I noticed a phone number that you could call 1 – 844 – 505 – 2993, in just a few minutes a young lady answered asking what the problem was. I explained the problem and she told me to delete the app and then download the app again. (It also dawned on me that I had recently bought a new phone, and the apps were transferred to the new phone which may have had something to do with this problem) at any rate as soon as I downloaded the Netflix app. My password worked just fine. I was very happy with this phone call and the resolution of my problem which would have not occurred without using the phone number above and the young lady on the phone telling me what to do. Unfortunately, many companies are not providing a toll-free helpline for their products, it’s cheaper just to have a bot answer your questions or several links describing a solution to each possible problem. I think it’s great that Netflix continues to pay for a helpline for instances just like this.
Title: Real customer service!

He then kept telling me they would refund £99 to my account which had been compromised and that I should contact the Police after the call. This was worrying as I still could only pick out a few words from each thing he said so ‘account compromised’ and ‘contact Police’ are not things you take lightly!!!!  At this point my husband became involved ……he had as much trouble understanding him and queried ‘are we actually speaking with Netflix or is this a scam?’Anyway it resulted in cancelling all our accounts with Netflix and losing all our saved films and 4 profiles on the account. In the end he said he was refunding £10.99 ……which my husband and I both agreed the previous conversation he had constantly said £99!!  To be honest I am none the wiser but I have cancelled all my accounts now so 🤷🏻‍♀️

Content: My account got hacked but they were great at sorting it. Fortunately my bank notifies me when scheduled payments are due to go out and the new amount was for almost 6x what I normally pay!It did take me a little while to navigate how to get support and I reduced my plan that someone else had increased and removed the two extra profiles that had somehow got access to my account - but didn't want to wait a month to get my normal fee and pay for this fraudulent activity in the meantime!I ended up going on Chat and the person was brilliant - they quickly went through security and cancelled the higher package and extra accounts at their end so they could refund the higher charge then I could restart my package at my normal rate. Refund happened immediately! I did ask to leave feedback requesting multi-step verification before new accounts are allowed to be added and she said she'd feed this back for me.I always prefer Netflix to any other streaming service - great mix of film and tv, both original productions and others. Much better than other streaming services than advertise a film but then you have to pay to rent or add an extra package - or who have more limited film/tv and confusing dashboards. I've been with Netflix for around 10 years or more. This is the first time a hacking issue has happened and I'm really happy they sorted it so well :)

Content: For 10 years, I was a very satisfied Netflix customer, although my kids probably watched it more than I did. I opted for a plan with two streams. Whether on vacation, on the go, or at our various homes, Netflix was always with us. To be fair, I even convinced my own mother to get her own account. Then, two weeks ago, Netflix informed me via my iPad at home, connected to my own Wi-Fi, that I wasn’t in my home network and needed to request permission to use Netflix temporarily for two weeks on my iPad. That felt unnecessarily unfriendly and unprofessional to me. With services like Apple or YouTube, family sharing works seamlessly, and they don't care whether I’m at home or not. But for Netflix to fail at recognizing my home after 10 years? That’s just amateurish. It seems they no longer care about individual customers. Well, good luck without me – I certainly won’t be recommending this service to anyone anymore.

Content: I’m extremely disappointed with Netflix’s recent changes. Once upon a time, Netflix was much better. Now, it’s a shadow of what it used to be – with many shows getting cancelled, limited movie and series options, and endless ads. But the biggest letdown? You can't even stream content if you're outside the country your profile is set to.Traveling used to be easy with Netflix – you could stream, download, and watch your favorite shows on the go. Now, even the download button is practically useless, as content disappears when you’re in another country. The inconvenience of being unable to watch a show just because ads aren’t available in your current location is ridiculous.If you stay in another country for over 25 days, you’re out of luck unless you go through the hassle of changing your profile country, which takes time. It’s just not the service it once was, and even Prime Video offers a better experience.At this point, Netflix is getting outdated, and for what they're charging, it’s simply not worth it. I’m canceling my subscription.

Content: I have not been a consistent Netflix user as my wife and I lead busy lives but subscribe to it about once a year for 3 months. This year our 3 months is over and to be fair we enjoyed quite a few videos this time, a small number of great videos, a larger number of good-ish videos, and a lot of woke dross to navigate past. My gripe though is with cancellation.We always log in using our smartphones and of course it is seamless once the password has been entered. But, couldn't cancel using my phone this time. Found the page in my account (Managed Subscription I think) and navigated to Cancel Subscription. It mattered not how many times I would press this it wouldn't cancel.I was forced to go to my laptop and go through the whole process there and it worked first time. This seems to me to be a deliberate attempt to hinder a subscriber from leaving,. What if you don't have a laptop. I cannot say I won't be back but as we already rent DVDs via Cinema Paradiso I likely will probably this time resist returning.

Content: I’m done with Netflix. After paying for my subscription, I found out—only AFTER—that I’m limited to 15 downloads a month on the Standard with ads plan. So when I deleted some downloads to make room for others, those 15 downloads just vanished. I couldn’t download anything else. So now, I’m stuck with nothing for the rest of the month, and Netflix’s response? "Wait until your next billing cycle." Seriously?I reached out to support, hoping they could fix this mess. The agent, Faishal, was polite but completely useless. He basically told me my options were to upgrade (so pay more money) or just wait. So even though I paid for those 15 downloads, I’m screwed? How is that remotely fair?And why wasn’t this made clear from the start? There was no warning that once I delete a download, it’s gone forever. Plus, I can’t even see how many downloads other plans offer unless I dig through their website after the fact. This feels like a total bait-and-switch.When I asked for the contact info for complaints, I was told there isn’t one. So basically, Netflix doesn’t care if their customers are pissed off.That was the last straw for me. I unsubscribed right then and there. The way they handle this nonsense, plus the useless customer service, is just unacceptable. I’m taking my money elsewhere because clearly, Netflix doesn’t value its customers.
Title: I’m done with Netflix

Content: I canceled my Netflix account and it was paid up through August.  I tried opening Netflix and it wanted me to sign up again. So, I figured it was closed, right? Then I noticed the automatic payment came out for Sept. So I signed back into my account and they took out another payment for signing up again.  So I had to contact them and let them know what happened.  Then I thought to check payment to Netflix with my bank account and it turns out that they were still taking out payments for my old account that I canceled before I signed up for an account that uses my email rather than the old one that used a different email.  So they said they'll refund six months but then I'll have to file a dispute with my bank. Wow.That's a really bad practice they're using to continue taking payments on closed accounts.  I'm glad I looked into it.
Title: Bad practices in automatic payments

Content: Netflix has changed its user interface. They say they tested it before they made the change for everyone, but clearly they tested it with under 25 year-old gamers since the home page of each profile is stuck in an endless loop of games even though there isn't a single game in my profile. The first rule of marketing is that you design your product in a fashion that will attract the greatest number of customers.  Unemployed under 25 year olds may spend more time playing games, but it is over 40 year olds who will keep their subscriptions and who have the $.  I have been with Netflix for 21 years and if they don't change the interface back or at least give us the option to choose they are going to lose more customers, particularly their older ones.  They also make it impossible to contact them.  I tried chat twice and the first time they never picked up even though the wait time was supposed to be 1 minute and the second time they hung up on me. It was also obvious that though I am in California and it is morning, they sent me to a chat attendant who is well out of the country.  The 2 email addresses I found on the web were kicked out as nonexistent.  Clearly, they don't understand the expression "if it ain't broke, don't fix it."
Title: Netflix has changed its user interface and it stinks

Content: Netflix does not have faith in their own supervisors to make a decision that would support customer service and still protect the company. I spent 2 hours with 5 different people, 2 of those supervisors, and they all had the same level of no customer support. Everyone was understanding and sympathetic, but no one had the permission to fix my issue. What is the point of giving a title of supervisor if they have the exact same permissions as an entry level customer rep. My account was hacked, password changed with no reach out from Netflix to confirm it was me. That person removed my 2 extra members and invited them self twice to my now open extra member slots. This happened within a 3 minute span so even if i had seen the password reset immediately they did their deed before i could react. I went to "Customer support" for help - there is no customer support because everyone's hands are tied. you are only allowed 2 extra members per billing cycle and the fraudulent "Netflix Support" acct (what an ironic name they chose) took my two slots away. this was on the 13th, my billing cycle is the 12th, so I have to wait until next month the 12th to have the priviledge of readding my family. the NF rep cancelled the bogus accounts but leaves me high and dry paying for 2 extra slots ($16) that absolutely no one can use. And the supervisors who clearly can see i was railroaded cannot do anything to override this rule. NF - 1. YOU allowed my password change with no verification. 2. YOU canceled the bogus members. 3. YOU are now penalizing me for your failure at customer service. to add the topping the last supervisor told me the same thing happened to him a few months back, yet the ridiculous policy of no overrides remains even at the dis-service to your own employees! How are you still in business?Why do you have supervisors if they have no ability to make decisions that might keep your customers happy. I am shopping for other service. You burned a bridge.
Title: Netflix does not trust their staff

I hope Netflix will work towards offering more global access to its library in the future.

Content: I’m not going to lie, I don’t pick through my Credit cards for every charge. I know I should but my entire life is charged on 1 card, so unless it’s a bigger charge I don’t really pay attention. However because it was recent I noticed a charge from Netflix. I cancelled my Netflix account March 2023. That was the last month that ever should have been charged to me. I searched my credit card and found that I have been charged since May 2023. I called Netflix and they explained to me that my account was compromised and they changed the account information but used my card. I would assume that they would refund me my money as they could see that the account was hacked after I closed it. However that’s not the case. He told me on the phone that he could only refund the latest payment and I would have to go through my bank to dispute the charges. My bank told me they can only go back 3 months. So I reached out to Netflix via chat to see if they had a fraud department or anyone that could explain to me how someone was able to change my account after I closed it. She sent me a link to show me how to make sure my account was secure. Once my account is closed, isn’t security their issue? Shouldn’t they remove my credit card information if my account is closed? They allowed over $300 to be charged to my card and won’t give me any information or help. I did a little bit of a search and it looks like a lot of people have had issues with Netflix charges. But where do you go when their not willing to take care of their customers and their credit card information?

Content: I signed up in my (non-US) country in Aug 2015, and enjoyed this service for 9 years. I never once stopped or paused my account and never had a major issue until this year. After being assured by an agent in April 2024, that I could use my account on two different WiFi networks (in my country), I upgraded to a more expensive plan, but then Netflix changed policies, and this was no longer allowed. With my original plan discontinued, I was forced to switch my plan on July 24, 2024 (while in my country) to the only cheaper plan was an ad-supported plan for $6.99. A week later, I turn on Netflix (for the first time since switching) and see a notice telling me that the ad-supported plan in not available in my country (the same one that I've been in this whole time) and a Netflix agent is now telling me that I signed up somewhere else when I was very physically in my country on August 1, 2015 (which according to Netflix, is when I signed up).  It's a week into this "non-existent" new plan and I have not been offered a refund, neither can I even find a link to how to request one, but now I am supposed to go pay $15.49 to switch to an ad-free plan, or cancel and wait until the next billing cycle (23 days) to watch Netflix again under a plan supported in the country where I've lived all my life and been a Netflix customer for 9 years? Well, no. These bait and switch policies have become old and Prime does not give me this amount of stress. Sorry to have to go, but this is too much frustration for something that's supposed to be fun and entertaining.
Title: The constant policy changes to grasp at customers' every penny has become too frustrating!

For those brown coats old enough to remember, it's like experiencing the whole Firefly incident all over. And over. And over.  And over again. Content: Worst customer service I have ever experienced from Netflix tonight. So somebody hacked my email account tonight. Had a couple of emails saying there had been some suspicious activity on my hotmail account followed by emails from Netflix saying the email address and phone number on my account had been changed. I had to change the password and update security info on my emails by which time the hacker had already deleted those emails from Netflix.I appreciate security is important but still had assumed Netflix would be able to work with me to sort this out. They started off saying they had the activity flagged as suspicious and they would help me recover my account. They said they would send me a secure link to enter my payment card details but the link never came. Then they asked the date I joined Netflix. Who the hell would know that off the top of their head? I had to check my emails and gave them the most recent date i rejoined as i did have a break from Netflix. They came back saying that was incorrect and they needed the original date. As that was 2 years ago took me a while to find in my emails and by the time i sent the original date they said my communication was flagged as suspicious and they couldn't help me.I honestly thought they were joking. They said it was noted on the account and nobody from Netflix could help me anymore. I did say if they couldn't give me access back to my account could they just close it down but they said no and i would have to contact my bank to stop any payments. They are actual thieves and in my opinion as big a criminal as those who hacked my account. Won't be rejoining them, many much better subscription services out there who don't steal from their customers.

Content: Netflix 'upgraded' it's service.Now there is no service - just constant buffering.Netflix recommended using a Firestick, but constant buffering and no service continues.Netflix continues to take payments and profits while no longer offering the service customers pay for.
Title: 'Upgrade' Means No Service

Content: Every month they take money from the card for paying them, but the problem is that they don’t solve the problem that we have as a customers. Every day when I want to watch something movie or series or cartoon whatever , it won’t start playing, it sign me out from the app, then I have to sign out my account, then write again the username and pass a then play whatever I want to watch. The internet connection is ok everything is ok but the app wont work properly. So I give one star review because of that. Hope they’ll fix that thing soon.
Title: Bad review

Content: The tech chat help did nothing to solve my constant "this tv isn't part of your netflix household". The network on my end was set as was required by Netflix, I paid extra to make sure I have a static IP address. I ran around a troubleshooting merry go round 5 times with them and they did nothing. When I provided proof that my internal network and internet provider was all set up cotrectly " Rafael" the customer service supervisor ghosted me in the chat for 25 minutes then kicked me out of the chat and ended the session. I tried to start a new chat to see if I was kicked out due to "timer" and the chat link kept sending me back to the same old chat even after I rebooted my laptop. So I cancelled and will never go back again. BTW I was a top tier customer since 2015. I encorage a complete boycott of netflix services.
Title: The tech chat help did nothing to solve…

Content: A star for the viewing experience. A star for the Netflix originals. And one star because I'm a nice person.Despite the three stars I'm no longer a Netflix customer - I've just shut down my account after years of subscribing. I shared an account with my sister and if the Netflix CEO thinks it's all about money, he's wrong. I live far away from my family and sharing that Netflix account was a kind of substitute for spending time together. My sister and I could recommend films to each other and share opinions and experiences.It might sound like a small thing, but for me it was a great added value. Neither myself or my sister have time to watch a lot of TV, and when the no sharing rule applied to us, we realised Netflix didn't have enough to offer for us to want have separate accounts. We paid for two devices and only watched on two devices, so I don't feel we did anything wrong. For a long time now we mainly rewatched films and shows because somehow Netflix algorithm couldn't figure out our preferences to recommend much of the relevant new stuff to us. It seemed as if we had watched all that there was for us on Netflix, and could only hope for a new season of our favourite shows to be released some time in the future. The no sharing rule pushed us to explore other options on the market, especially those which don't mind sharing.
Title: No sharing rule is a big mistake

Content: My experience with Netflix Live chat has been really good, they are just people like you and me following the rules of the job, person I spoke to was helpful and friendly, my problem is the pleb who thought bringing in new plans of cost and package,  of course I went to  the ad plan at £5 a month, I was paying £7 or go to £11 without ad's. Then I went to watch something on my Samsung TV, to find ad plan won't work on this device! It's an effing Television! I can watch on my phone, haha, what are you doing? I suppose some bloke in a blue suit with brown shoes came up with that idea, so, pay £4 a month more or nothing, it's not the money, it's the principle.... Cancelled.
Title: My experience with Netflix Live chat…
